Emergency Dental Care

Immediate relief when you need it most. Same-day appointments for dental emergencies.

We're Here When You Need Us

Dental emergencies don't wait for convenient times. That's why we offer same-day appointments and walk-in availability at both our locations. Our extended hours mean you don't have to suffer through the night.

Common Dental Emergencies We Treat

Severe Toothache

Immediate pain relief and treatment for infected or damaged teeth causing severe discomfort.

Broken or Chipped Teeth

Quick repairs to restore damaged teeth and prevent further complications.

Lost Fillings or Crowns

Emergency replacement or repair of dental restorations to protect exposed teeth.

Dental Abscesses

Urgent treatment for infections that can become serious if left untreated.

What to Expect During Your Emergency Visit

1

Immediate Assessment

We'll quickly evaluate your condition and assess the severity of your emergency.

2

Pain Management

Your comfort is our priority. We'll provide immediate pain relief while addressing the underlying issue.

3

Treatment Plan

We'll explain your treatment options and perform necessary procedures to resolve the emergency.

4

Follow-Up Care

We'll schedule any necessary follow-up appointments and provide aftercare instructions.

After-Hours Emergency?

If you're experiencing extreme discomfort or need immediate medical attention outside our operating hours, please go directly to your nearest hospital emergency room.

For non-critical emergencies, call our office and leave a message. We'll get back to you as soon as possible when we reopen.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do you accept walk-in emergency patients?

Yes! We welcome walk-in emergency patients at both locations. While we'll do our best to see you immediately, calling ahead helps us prepare for your arrival and minimize wait times.

What should I do for a knocked-out tooth?

Time is critical! Gently rinse the tooth without scrubbing, try to place it back in the socket if possible, or keep it in milk. Get to our office immediately - we have the best chance of saving the tooth within the first hour.

How much does emergency dental care cost?

Costs vary depending on the treatment required. We offer direct billing to most insurance providers and will discuss all costs upfront. Your health is our priority - we'll work with you to find a solution that fits your budget.
